result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacy A Holtz

defendant.name: Holtz, Lacy A
defendant.address: c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, 751 Co Rd K, Fond du Lac, WI 54937

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Attorney Michael Blum is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Court Office.

ADDRESS INFO for Lacy A Holtz
Current: c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, 751 Co Rd K, Fond du Lac, WI 54937 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 1025 N 18Th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Competency hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lacy A Holtz appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reviewed Dr. Nehring's report - the report explains Dr Nehrings opinion that the defendant is not competent to proceed and her recommendation that the defendant undergo treatment to regain competency.
The State stipulates to the findings within Dr Nehring's report.
The defendant contests to the findings and wishes to have Attorney Harrison (appointed in 21CF528) withdraw.  She wants to apply for Court appointed counsel.  
Court grants the motion for defense counsel to withdraw.  Attorney Harrison to draft order.  
Court finds cause to extend the time limits and resets competency hearing to 11-28-2022 at 1:30pm.  Clerk to mail the defendant Court appointed counsel paperwork.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.

10:37 am - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lacy A Holtz appeared by video, in custody, at Taycheedah Correctional.  Counsel waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Initial appearance on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:49 am - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lacy A Holtz appeared by video, in custody, at Taycheedah Correctional.  Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Defendant has not seen a copy of the complaint.  Copy of complaint and PD information sheet mailed to defendant.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lacy A Holtz not in court. 
Defendant is in custody at Taycheedah, which was confirmed with the facility that she would be appearing via Zoom for her IA today.  The court will adjourn the matter and have the judicial assistant reset the IA with Taycheedah.  
IA reset to 07-14-2022 at 10:30am.
Initial appearance on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Re:  Disorderly conduct, on 06-03-22.   
Initial appearance is set for 06-30-22 at 10:30 a.m.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-30-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $150.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
